intro: Carpesium scandens, commonly known as the goat's beard, is a climbing plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its branched, hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical heads, typical of the daisy family. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature. Carpesium scandens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
